results.title: What is disease?
results.brief_description: A simple explanation of the nature of disease. Shows how diseases are transmitted and the deadly result of lack of personal and domestic cleanliness. Made specifically for South American native audiences.

results.title: What is cancer?
results.brief_description: This film was prepared specifically for the nursing profession. Explains the biology of the disease and emphasises that nurses have a special role in early diagnosis of the disease and in the rehabilitation of patients. Illustrates the origin of caner in the body, the nature of cancer cells, and the spread of the disease through the body. Shows four methods of treatment; surgery, X-ray, radium, and the use of hormones. Charts are used to illustrate the importance of early cancer diagnosis. Explains how the nurse, understanding that cancer can be cured can help the patient overcome psychological fears and resume a normal life. Warning: some scenes may disturb.

results.title: What is an original print?
results.creator_credit: RATAS Arts Consultancy and Oxide City Productions
results.brief_description: A guide to the processes and techniques of original printmaking. Demonstrates relief prints (woodcuts, linocuts), incised or intaglio prints (engravings, etchings), lithography and serigraphy (silkscreen). Presented by Josef Lebovic.

results.title: What is a word processor? or Tale of two sisters
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, IBM (UK), Robert Reid and Peter Robinson
results.brief_description: A John Cleese training film which explains the principles and illustrates the nature of word processing. Shows all the aspects of office work which the processor can make quicker or easier, and provides a framework of understanding which dispels the mystery and threat surrounding this technology. Features John Cleese, Alison Steadman, Kay Stonham and Carol Hawkins. Photography by Arthur Wooster, sound by Bruce White, edited by Colin Sherman, narrated by Judi Dench, written by David Nobbs.

results.title: What is a map?
results.brief_description: A small girl, writing to her friend, attempts to explain what her bedroom looks like. By use of animation and photographic techniques, the concept of maps is introduced and explained, first in terms of the living room plan and then in terms of a map of the neighbourhood.
results.description: A small girl, writing to her friend, attempts to explain what her bedroom looks like. By use of animation and photographic techniques, the concept of maps is introduced and explained, first in terms of the living room plan and then in terms of a map of the neighbourhood.

results.title: What is a limit? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Edward Goldwyn and David Nelson
results.brief_description: Analysis is that branch of mathematics which gives precision to vague terms like ‘infinitely large’ and ‘infinitesimally small’ and is founded on the concept of a limit. In this program, ideas behind a limit are examined and a formal definition to the limit of a sequence is reached.

results.title: What is a firefighter?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch, David Ferris and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Brion Jones, Station Officer, M.F.B. who outlines the training and different tasks performed by fireman including rescuing people from fires, extinguishing fires, preventing the spread and property damage caused by fires, road rescue, assisting with chemical incidents, gas leaks and unusual rescues from cliffs, trenches and drains.

results.title: What is a curriculum day?
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, Lily Steiner and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A primary and postprimary teacher and parent/school councillor outline what is involved in a curriculum day. They discuss the benefits for both parents and teachers in evaluating school programs and ideas to facilitate the development of working relationships between both parties.

results.title: What is a computer? (NP)
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, International Computers and Robert Reid
results.brief_description: This film gives an introduction to the computer. Explains the relationship between the central processing unit and the computer’s peripherals - the video console, the printer, the card reader, the magnetic tape unit and the disc unit. Narrated by John Cleese. Also suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
